name: Nordic Light Hotel

reviews.text: True the lights are a bit gimmicky and you'll either love them or hate them, but this hotel was just what I was looking for at the end of a long flight.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's situated right at the end of the platform for the Arlanda Express and was a five / ten minute walk to the main business district. My flight arrived at 23:00 into Arlanda and I was settled into my room within an hour.
reviews.title: Choose another place to stay!
we loved this hotel
reviews.text: Check in and out was friendly and efficient, the room was a decent size and clean. There were lots of traces of that famous Scandanavian design flair aside from the lights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't fault it
reviews.title: Great hotel - really comfortable beds.

reviews.text: We payed 2450 swedish SEK for one night in a Superior Mood Queen Room. Their second best room. The room was small, the beds where horrible, felt like speeping on a rock. Crappy old TV. No I didnt likes this place at all!
reviews.title: Unique and enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really cute hotel in downtown Stockholm. My husband and I picked it for our honeymoon based on a variety of factors: They were voted "sexiest hotel in the world" by Elle Magazine, they got a great review on TripAdvisor, and they advertised in the GayStockholm travel guide.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but not what it was hyped up to be...

reviews.text: First, the pluses: GREAT location. Literally across the street from the Arlanda Express Train Station downtown. The staff was helpful (they sent us to a great restaurant, Ulla Windbladh, on Djurgarden for our last night in town), and the breakfast was both tasty and of a wide selection.
reviews.title: Probably the best choice in the area

reviews.text: Next, the minuses: While my husband and I weren't expecting a large room (we travel in Europe often and are familiar with the size of European hotel rooms), this was quite small, even by European standards. The bathroom shower did not drain well and we had to pile up extra towels by the floor of the shower in order to keep the bathroom from flooding.
reviews.title: What a disaster ...

likes.disliked: — Front office staff with bad attitude and incompetent administration staff

reviews.text: All in all, it was definitely fun, but not what I would call groundbreakingly sexy. But still, a good hotel, fairly competitively priced, and worth the trip.
reviews.title: Good, but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at most of the hotels around Stockholm Central Station and I would probably say this is the best. You would really only choose to be here to be near the Arlanda Express or a meeting venue. It's not the most beautiful strip of a very beautiful city.
reviews.title: Really liked it especially the public areas

likes.liked: — The beautiful bar and reception. Very cool feel to the place.
likes.disliked: — Room was a bit small as was the bathroom.

reviews.text: The Nordic Light hotel is now ten years old and I think, frankly, showing its age in a few tiny ways. For a (reasonably expensive) boutique hotel it lacks some of the little touches that one might expect. For example the TV is a chunky old thing, there's no iPod docking station to play your tunes, and the lighting effects in the Superior Queen room we stayed in were not as spectacular as one is led to believe - although it plays some interesting tricks on your clothing.
reviews.title: Good but not spectacular

reviews.text: Nonetheless the staff were helpful, the bed is comfortable, the room spacious and clean, the bathroom well equipped and there is free fixed internet in the room plus a laptop-sized room safe. Breakfast was excellent, overall, although some of the pastries were a day old. And the wardrobes are very small.
reviews.title: Chic Design Hotel in central Stockholm

likes.liked: — Cocktails were out of this world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thinking about it, the fact that I'm complaining about the age of the pastries shows that it's not a bad place to stay. But there are some newer, interesting hotels that have opened nearby such as the Clarion Sign. Consider checking for deals there as well as visiting the Nordic Light website.
reviews.title: Cool and trendy but expensive - even for STHLM

reviews.text: And if you are visiting Stockholm, earn less than $250,000 a year and like more than one alcoholic drink a night, I *highly* recommend stopping in the Duty Free shop before leaving your departure airport. Otherwise you will be very thirsty. Learn from our mistake...
reviews.title: Innovative, awful neighbour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Having re-read the reviews here, a final thought: the fact that the hotel manager reads the reviews and responds to them is worth an extra star in itself. Good on you, Martin Åkesson. If only all hotels were so reactive to their customers' comments.)
reviews.title: A Bit Too Minimalist Chic

reviews.text: Nordic Light sells itself on its design credentials but though it is stylish I didn't feel it was particularly special in this respect. However, it is a comfortable, clean and well-thought out hotel in a great location adjacent to Stockholm's Central Station, right next to the Arlanda Express rail link to the airport.
reviews.title: Stylish and Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was simple but comfortable with an exceptionally comfortable bed and some nice touches like an umbrella and shoe horn. The wardrobes were amongst the smallest I have ever experienced; fine for the weekend that I was there but if you were staying longer it might be a problem.
reviews.title: Love the hotel !! Modern simplicity hotel

reviews.text: The bar/restaurant is stylish though again not exceptional for a modern city hotel. The breakfast buffet was great; lots of choice and good quality. Dinner was less satisfactory with a very limited and not very classy choice, though the food was perfectly adequate and of good quality and the service was fine.
reviews.title: Becoming more and more disappointed..

reviews.text: The best aspect of the hotel are the staff who were all helpful, multi-lingual, polite and efficient.
reviews.title: Swedish Modern

reviews.text: A modern simplistic hotel in Stockholm, representing Nordic designs in the hotel - from the brochures to the magazines, breakfast and eating utensils.
reviews.title: Slick.....

description: Nordic Light Hotel is Stockholm's design hotel, with an interior inspired by the northern light. The hotel is located in the city centre of Stockholm right next to the best shopping, nightlife and the express-train to Arlanda airport. All 175 rooms share the same well thought-out design and the atmosphere in our restaurant and bar is both cool and inviting. At the hotel, our friendly staff guides you to the best restaurants, clubs and shops.
